definition: (interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin

sentences.english: Her yawn suggests that she is sleepy.
sentences.chinese: 她打哈欠表示她很困了。

sentences.english: "Yawning is a really big deal, " Provine said.
She yawned gracefully in my face.
sentences.chinese: 她嬌嗔地對着我的臉打了一個哈欠。

sentences.english: I gaped , thinking at first that he must be doing some kind of comedy act.
sentences.chinese: 我打了個哈欠，我開始心想他肯定是做了搞笑的事情。

sentences.english: Looking away from people or yawning will, in most cases, make me appear to be uninterested .
sentences.chinese: 轉移視線或不停地打哈欠大多說明這個人不感興趣。

sentences.english: Not allow Ye Lingqing say more, door closed with a yawn. Ye Lingqing heart…
sentences.chinese: 不容葉凌青多說，看門的打着哈欠關了門。

sentences.english: The public response from Washington has been a barely-stifled yawn.
sentences.chinese: 華盛頓的公開回應幾乎像是捂着嘴巴打哈欠。

sentences.english: The truth is: the first time you yawned was likely as a fetus.
sentences.chinese: 其實，你第一次打哈欠應該是在胎兒時期。

sentences.english: We also know that yawning is contagious or catching.
sentences.chinese: 我們知道打哈欠是有傳染性的或者易傳染。

sentences.english: For example, excessive yawning often precedes seizures in people with epilepsy and pain in people with migraine headaches.
sentences.chinese: 例如，癲癇和偏頭痛患者就會經常發現他們哈欠過多。
他打個哈欠，伸一伸懶腰。

sentences.english: A yawn is more contagious than any of these.
sentences.chinese: 打哈欠比任何這些狀況都更易傳染。
彼得柯克蘭偷偷地打了個哈欠。

sentences.english: John yawned and scratched his chin.
sentences.chinese: 約翰打個哈欠，撓撓下巴。

sentences.english: Can die already skin, can let labial strong pliable but strong again, not be afraid of gape .
sentences.chinese: 既能去脣上死皮，又能讓嘴脣強韌，不怕打哈欠了。

definition: to stretch oneself (on waking or when tired etc)
to doze/to take a nap/nodding off to sleep
listless/dispirited/washed out/also written 沒精打彩|没精打彩
